00042 #ifndef _KUKA_FRI_TRANSFORMATION_CLIENT_H
00043 #define _KUKA_FRI_TRANSFORMATION_CLIENT_H
00044 
00045 #include <vector>
00046 
00047 /** Kuka namespace */
00048 namespace KUKA
00049 {
00050 namespace FRI
00051 {
00052 
00053    // forward declaration
00054    struct ClientData;
00055    class TransformationContainer;
00056 
00057    /**
00058     * \brief Abstract FRI transformation client. 
00059     * 
00060     * A transformation client allows the user to send transformation matrices cyclically to the 
00061     * KUKA Sunrise controller for manipulating the transformation of a dynamic frame. 
00062     * These matrices can be provided by an external sensor. 
00063     * <br>
00064     * Custom transformation clients have to derived from this class. 
00065     * The callback provide() is cyclically called by the client application
00066     * (ClientApplication) whenever new FRI messages arrive.
00067     * 
00068     * <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b> 
00069     */
00070    class TransformationClient
00071    {
00072       
00073       friend class ClientApplication;
00074      
00075    public:
00076       
00077       /**
00078        * <br>  <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b>  <br> 
00079        *  \brief Constructor
00080        **/
00081       TransformationClient();
00082       
00083       /** <br> <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b>   <br> 
00084        * \brief Virtual destructor. 
00085        **/
00086       virtual ~TransformationClient();
00087       
00088       /** 
00089        * <br>  <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b>  <br>
00090        * \brief Callback which is called whenever a new FRI message arrives. 
00091        *
00092        *  In this callback all requested transformations have to be set.
00093        *  
00094        *  \see getRequestedTransformationIDs(), setTransformation()
00095        *  
00096        */
00097       virtual void provide() = 0;
00098       
00099       
00100    protected:
00101 
00102       /** 
00103        * <br>  <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b>  <br>
00104        * \brief  Returns a vector of identifiers of requested transformation matrices.
00105        * 
00106        * The custom TransformationClient has to provide data for transformation matrices with these
00107        * identifiers. 
00108        * 
00109        * 
00110        * @return vector of IDs of requested transformations
00111        */
00112       const std::vector<const char*>* getRequestedTransformationIDs() const;
00113       
00114       /** 
00115        * <br>  <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b>  <br>
00116        * 
00117        * \brief Get the timestamp of the current received FRI monitor message in Unix time. 
00118        * 
00119        * This method returns the seconds since 0:00, January 1st, 1970 (UTC).
00120        * Use getTimestampNanoSec() to increase your timestamp resolution when
00121        * seconds are insufficient. 
00122        * 
00123        * 
00124        * 
00125        * @return timestamp encoded as Unix time (seconds)
00126        */
00127       const unsigned int getTimestampSec() const;
00128       
00129       /** 
00130        * <br>  <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b>  <br>
00131        * \brief Get the nanoseconds elapsed since the last second (in Unix time).
00132        * 
00133        * This method complements getTimestampSec() to get a high resolution 
00134        * timestamp. 
00135        * 
00136        * @return timestamp encoded as Unix time (nanoseconds part)
00137        */
00138       const unsigned int getTimestampNanoSec() const;
00139       
00140       /**
00141        * <br>  <b>This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.</b>  <br>
00142        * \brief Set the transformation matrix of the current cyclic step.
00143        * 
00144        * A transformation matrix has 3x4 elements. It consists of a rotational matrix (3x3 elements)
00145        * and a translational vector (3x1 elements). The complete transformation matrix has the
00146        * following structure: <br>
00147        * [Transformation(3x4)] = [Rotation(3x3) | Translation(3x1) ]
00148        * <p>
00149        * All provided transformation matrices need a timestamp for which they are valid. 
00150        * The timestamp handed over to this function must base on the timestamp provided by
00151        * the robot controller (see getTimestampSec(), getTimestampNanoSec()).
00152        * <p>
00153        * If the callback provide() is called more often than a new transformation matrix has been
00154        * calculated, just set again the last calculated transformation matrix together with the 
00155        * last used timestamp.
00156        *  
00157        * @param transformationID Identifier string of the transformation matrix
00158        * @param transformationMatrix Provided transformation matrix
00159        * @param timeSec Timestamp encoded as Unix time (seconds)
00160        * @param timeNanoSec Timestamp encoded as Unix time (nanoseconds part)
00161        * 
00162 
00163        * 
00164        */
00165       void setTransformation(const char* transformationID, 
00166             double transformationMatrix[3][4], unsigned int timeSec, unsigned int timeNanoSec);
00167       
00168    private:     
00169       TransformationContainer* _data; //!< container for the data of the transformation
00170       
00171       /**
00172        * \brief Method to create and initialize the client data structure (used internally).
00173        * 
00174        * @return newly allocated client data structure
00175        */
00176       ClientData* createData();
00177       
00178       /**
00179        * \brief
00180        * @param clientData
00181        */
00182       void linkData(ClientData* clientData);
00183       
00184       /**
00185        * \brief Forbidden copy constructor.
00186        */
00187       TransformationClient(const TransformationClient& obj);
00188    };
00189    
00190 }
00191 }
00192 
00193 #endif // _KUKA_FRI_TRANSFORMATION_CLIENT_H
